Sessions

Our peer-led sessions combine skillsharing, discussion, and collaboration. Proposals are open through April 10!

Propose a Session

Proposing a session only takes a few minutes, and we’re here to help. We’re publishing already submitted proposals here (minus private info), and our sessions page includes examples and detailed guidance. If you have questions or get stuck, send us a note and we’ll get back to you ASAP.

So tell us, what’s your perfect SRCCON session?

About SRCCON

SRCCON is a conference for developers, interactive designers, and other people who love to code in and near newsrooms. Join us in Minneapolis June 25 and 26 for two days of peer-to-peer sessions built around conversation and collaboration. Keep up with updates @SRCCON.

About OpenNews

Knight-Mozilla OpenNews is a joint project of Mozilla and the Knight Foundation that supports the growing community of news developers, designers, and data reporters helping journalism thrive on the open web. More at opennews.org and @OpenNews.
